subject: Photography
title: Looking vs. Seeing
description: A micro-lesson that makes Looking vs. Seeing usable.

hook.text: You look at a thousand things every day. How many do you actually see? There's a difference.

buildup.text: Looking is passive â€” your eyes scan the world automatically. Seeing is active â€” conscious, deliberate observation.

discovery.text: Photographers train themselves to switch from looking to seeing: noticing light, shadow, line, and color with intent.

twist.text: Most people stop truly seeing familiar places. The commute, the kitchen, the office â€” invisible through routine.

climax.text: Photography revives seeing. Carrying a camera turns the ordinary world back into something worth examining.

punchline.text: You've been looking your whole life. Start seeing.

quiz.question: What is the difference between looking and seeing?
options: Looking is passive scanning while seeing is conscious, deliberate observation
